properties.name: alarmsRefreshType
properties.description:
Defines the type of refresh mechanism used for alarms in the application.

  • 'realtime': Utilizes a realtime mechanism for updating alarms.
  • 'interval': Utilizes HTTP polling at regular intervals to refresh the alarms.

This setting allows to switch between realtime and interval-based refresh methods.
properties.rawdescription:
Defines the type of refresh mechanism used for alarms in the application.

- 'realtime': Utilizes a realtime mechanism for updating alarms.
- 'interval': Utilizes HTTP polling at regular intervals to refresh the alarms.

This setting allows to switch between realtime and interval-based refresh methods.

properties.name: brandingCssVars
properties.description: Object with properties that will be converted to CSS custom variables.
properties.rawdescription: Object with properties that will be converted to CSS custom variables.

properties.name: brandingEntry
properties.deprecationMessage: Add your global styles via the angular.json file.
properties.description: Path to the branding entry file. (Set it to false to disable any styling. You can handle the styling then on your own e.g. in an angular.json file using ng-cli)
properties.rawdescription: Path to the branding entry file. (Set it to false to disable any styling. You can handle the styling then on your own e.g. in an angular.json file using ng-cli)

jsdoctags.comment: Add your global styles via the angular.json file.

properties.name: brandingPreview
properties.description: Enables the branding preview mode. If set to true, the dynamicOptionsUrl will be polled regularly for changes. In case the lastUpdated field of the dynamic options changes, the page is reloaded in order to apply the new branding.
properties.rawdescription: Enables the branding preview mode. If set to true, the `dynamicOptionsUrl` will be polled regularly for changes. In case the `lastUpdated` field of the dynamic options changes, the page is reloaded in order to apply the new branding.

properties.name: brandingUrl
properties.description: URL to *.css file which will replace default branding.
properties.rawdescription: URL to *.css file which will replace default branding.

properties.name: breadcrumbs
properties.description: Enable or disable breadcrumbs in the header for groups and devices (default: false).
properties.rawdescription: Enable or disable breadcrumbs in the header for groups and devices (default: false).

properties.name: companyName
properties.description: Name of company handling support requests from app users (displayed in notification message).
properties.rawdescription: Name of company handling support requests from app users (displayed in notification message).

properties.name: contentSecurityPolicy
properties.description: CSP string to be applied to index.html by replacing default values.
properties.rawdescription: CSP string to be applied to `index.html` by replacing default values.

properties.name: contextHelp
properties.description: Allows to enable or disable context help, or to override the default base URL used to load its contents. By default, the context help uses the same base URL as defined in the docsBaseUrl option (if this option is undefined, then the following value will be used: https://cumulocity.com/guides/{{version}}). Alternatively, if a string is provided here, it'll be used as the base URL and any {{ version }} placeholder will be replaced with the relevant docs version.
properties.rawdescription:
Allows to enable or disable context help, or to override the default base URL used to load its contents.
By default, the context help uses the same base URL as defined in the `docsBaseUrl` option
(if this option is undefined, then the following value will be used: `https://cumulocity.com/guides/{{version}}`).
Alternatively, if a string is provided here, it'll be used as the base URL
and any `{{ version }}` placeholder will be replaced with the relevant docs version.

properties.name: cookieBanner
properties.description: Cookie Banner configuration
properties.rawdescription: Cookie Banner configuration

properties.name: cookiePreferences
properties.description: Cookie preferences configuration. Here you can enable or disable cookie categories
properties.rawdescription: Cookie preferences configuration. Here you can enable or disable cookie categories

properties.name: copy
properties.description: Additional assets to copy to the build output. See https://github.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin for more information about the patterns to add here.
properties.rawdescription:
Additional assets to copy to the build output.
See https://github.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin for more information
about the patterns to add here.

properties.name: disableOnlyRootsQuery
properties.description: By default, cockpit and devicemanagement use the onlyRoots query to resolve root nodes. This could lead to performance issues, if a customer has a lot of root nodes. Therefore you can disable the use of this query with this flag.
properties.rawdescription:
By default, cockpit and devicemanagement use the onlyRoots query to resolve root nodes. This
could lead to performance issues, if a customer has a lot of root nodes. Therefore you can disable
the use of this query with this flag.

properties.name: disableTracking
properties.description: Disable user tracking
properties.rawdescription: Disable user tracking

properties.name: docs
properties.description: Documentation links settings.
properties.rawdescription: Documentation links settings.

properties.name: docsBaseUrl
properties.description: Base URL for documentation links (include {{ version }} placeholder, if you want versioned links).
properties.rawdescription: Base URL for documentation links (include `{{ version }}` placeholder, if you want versioned links).

properties.name: dynamicOptionsUrl
properties.description: URL to dynamically fetched options. If set to true or left undefined, an URL will be used based on the applications contextPath. If set to false, no dynamic options will be fetched.
properties.rawdescription:
URL to dynamically fetched options.
If set to `true` or left undefined, an URL will be used based on the applications contextPath.
If set to `false`, no dynamic options will be fetched.

properties.name: enableAllBetaFeatures
properties.description:
Enables all beta features in the application UI.

Note: This only affects features on the frontend. If a beta feature also requires backend support it must be enabled separately on the backend.
properties.rawdescription:
Enables all beta features in the application UI.

Note: This only affects features on the frontend.
If a beta feature also requires backend support it must be enabled separately on the backend.

properties.name: entryModule
properties.description: Entry module for Angular compiler (only used with lazy loaded routes), e.g. 'app.module.ts#AppModule'.
properties.rawdescription: Entry module for Angular compiler (only used with lazy loaded routes), e.g. `'app.module.ts#AppModule'`.

properties.name: exports
properties.description: NgModule export for plugins.
properties.rawdescription: NgModule export for plugins.

properties.name: extraCss
properties.description: Stylesheet (CSS) that will be added at runtime. The string should actually contain the CSS not a path or URL to it.
properties.rawdescription: Stylesheet (CSS) that will be added at runtime. The string should actually contain the CSS not a path or URL to it.

properties.name: extraCssUrls
properties.description: Array of URLs to additional *.css files to be loaded at runtime.
properties.rawdescription: Array of URLs to additional *.css files to be loaded at runtime.

properties.name: faviconUrl
properties.description: URL to favicon.
properties.rawdescription: URL to favicon.

properties.name: forceSetup
properties.description: Allows to force showing the setup wizard.
properties.rawdescription: Allows to force showing the setup wizard.

properties.name: forceUrlRemotes
properties.description: If set to true, only remotes defined in the remotes query parameter will be loaded.
properties.rawdescription: If set to true, only remotes defined in the `remotes` query parameter will be loaded.

properties.name: gainsightKey
properties.description: A key for the product experience software Gainsight.
properties.rawdescription: A key for the product experience software Gainsight.

properties.name: globalTitle
properties.description: HTML page title.
properties.rawdescription: HTML page title.

properties.name: guideHrefTemplate
properties.description: URL template for documentation links (default: '${docsBaseUrl}${partialUrl}').
properties.rawdescription: URL template for documentation links (default: `'${docsBaseUrl}${partialUrl}'`).

properties.name: hideBetaPreview
properties.description: Hides the beta preview section in the right drawer.
properties.rawdescription: Hides the beta preview section in the right drawer.

properties.name: hideHeader
properties.description: Hides the header bar
properties.rawdescription: Hides the header bar

properties.name: hideNavigator
properties.description: Collapse navigator on initial load.
properties.rawdescription: Collapse navigator on initial load.

properties.name: hidePlatformInformation
properties.description: Hides the "Platform information" in the right drawer, will overrule the "hidePowered" option
properties.rawdescription: Hides the "Platform information" in the right drawer, will overrule the "hidePowered" option

properties.name: hidePowered
properties.description: Hide "powered by" and version info at the bottom of the navigator and in the right drawer.
properties.rawdescription: Hide "powered by" and version info at the bottom of the navigator and in the right drawer.

properties.name: hideTypeDashboardForAssets
properties.description: Hides possibility to create typed dashboards for assets (and groups). If true, typed dashboards can be created only for devices. It is true by default.
properties.rawdescription:
Hides possibility to create typed dashboards for assets (and groups). If true, typed dashboards can be created only for devices.
It is true by default.

properties.name: i18nExtra
properties.description:
Allows to add custom translations. It is an optional property.

Its keys are language codes (https://cumulocity.com/guides/users-guide/getting-started/#a-name-languages-a-available-languages) and its values are objects with key-value pairs, where the key is the original string in English and the value - its translation.

  • Home: "Startseite"

For example you can add the translation of your custom cookie banner configured in the branding settings:

Example :
"i18nExtra": {
  "de": {
    "About cookies on Cumulocity IoT": "Informationen zu Cookies in Cumulocity IoT",
    "Click Agree and Proceed to accept cookies and go directly to the platform or click on Privacy Policy to see detailed descriptions of the used cookies.": "Klicken Sie auf Zustimmen und fortfahren, um Cookies zu akzeptieren und direkt zur Plattform zu gelangen, oder klicken Sie auf Datenschutzrichtlinie, um detaillierte Beschreibungen der verwendeten Cookies anzuzeigen."
  }
}

properties.name: icon
properties.description: Application icon to be displayed in app switcher and header bar.
properties.rawdescription: Application icon to be displayed in app switcher and header bar.

properties.name: indexTemplate
properties.description: Path to custom index.html (otherwise default one will be used).
properties.rawdescription: Path to custom index.html (otherwise default one will be used).

properties.name: isSetup
properties.description: Indicates if the application needs to show the setup wizard.
properties.rawdescription: Indicates if the application needs to show the setup wizard.

properties.name: label
properties.description: Is used for plugins to indicate their owner. Cumulocity plugins are marked with OFFICIAL label. You can use the special "ARCHIVED" label to mark them as archived.
properties.rawdescription:
Is used for plugins to indicate their owner. Cumulocity plugins are marked with OFFICIAL label.
You can use the special "ARCHIVED" label to mark them as archived.

properties.name: languages
properties.description:
Allows for adding or overriding languages available in the application.

Its keys are language codes and its values are objects with the following properties:

  • name: English name of the language,
  • nativeName: native name of the language,
  • url: full URL to JSON file with compiled translations; if not defined, translations will be loaded from ${localePath}/${langCode}.json.

Example:

Example :
"languages": {
  "de": {
    "name": "German",
    "nativeName": "Deutsch",
    "url": "/apps/public/ui-assets/de.json"
  }
}

properties.name: localePath
properties.description: Path to the folder from which *.po files will be loaded.
properties.rawdescription: Path to the folder from which *.po files will be loaded.

properties.name: loginExtraLink
properties.description: Additional link(s) to display on login screen.
properties.rawdescription: Additional link(s) to display on login screen.

properties.name: loginRedirectPath
properties.description:
Defines to which path the user will be redirected in case he is not logged in yet.

This needs to be used for e.g. people who embed the application in an iframe in order to redirect to a none index.html file.
properties.rawdescription:
Defines to which path the user will be redirected in case he is not logged in yet.

This needs to be used for e.g. people who embed the application in an iframe in order to redirect to a none index.html file.

properties.name: mapConfig
properties.description: Allows to set default configurations on the maps.
properties.rawdescription: Allows to set default configurations on the maps.

properties.name: mapLayers
properties.description: Allows to set the map layers. If not set, defaults to open street map layer.
properties.rawdescription: Allows to set the map layers. If not set, defaults to open street map layer.

properties.name: mapNominatimUrl
properties.description: The URL used to lookup geo coordinates for a user provided address via nominatim API. Can be set to empty to disable the find address feature on the location tab. Uses: https://nominatim.openstreetmap.org/search?format=json&q={searchTerm} if not set.
properties.rawdescription:
The URL used to lookup geo coordinates for a user provided address via [nominatim API](https://nominatim.org/release-docs/develop/api/Search/).
Can be set to empty to disable the find address feature on the location tab.
Uses: `https://nominatim.openstreetmap.org/search?format=json&q={searchTerm}` if not set.

properties.name: mapWidgetHideMaxDeviceOnMapHint
properties.description: Allows to hide the hint that there are more devices with geo coordinates then displayed on the map widget and maps in general.
properties.rawdescription: Allows to hide the hint that there are more devices with geo coordinates then displayed on the map widget and maps in general.

properties.name: mapWidgetPageSize
properties.description: Allows to adjust the default pagesize of 100 items of the map widget and maps in general.
properties.rawdescription: Allows to adjust the default pagesize of 100 items of the map widget and maps in general.

properties.name: mapWidgetRealtimeDisabled
properties.description: Disables realtime updates on the map widget and maps in general.
properties.rawdescription: Disables realtime updates on the map widget and maps in general.

properties.name: messageBanner
properties.description: Message Banner configuration
properties.rawdescription: Message Banner configuration

properties.name: newsletter
properties.description: Show or hide a newsletter subscription checkbox in edit user modal.
properties.rawdescription: Show or hide a newsletter subscription checkbox in edit user modal.

properties.name: noAppSwitcher
properties.description: Hide application in app switcher (saved to the server).
properties.rawdescription: Hide application in app switcher (saved to the server).

properties.name: noLogin
properties.description: By default a WebSDK app requires the user to be logged in. In case you would like to develop just a static application, that does not require any kind of access to the backend, you can use this flag to disable the login screen. NOTE: not all WebSDK components support this, some might require the user to be logged in and won't work.
properties.rawdescription:
By default a WebSDK app requires the user to be logged in.
In case you would like to develop just a static application, that does not require any kind of access to the backend,
you can use this flag to disable the login screen.
NOTE: not all WebSDK components support this, some might require the user to be logged in and won't work.

properties.name: noPlugins
properties.description: Allows to opt out of supporting/loading plugins for this application.
properties.rawdescription: Allows to opt out of supporting/loading plugins for this application.

properties.name: noVersionWarning
properties.description: Allows to opt out of the version warning which is shown in the dev tools.
properties.rawdescription: Allows to opt out of the version warning which is shown in the dev tools.

properties.name: remotes
properties.description: List of imported remote plugins.
properties.rawdescription: List of imported remote plugins.

properties.name: rightDrawer
properties.description: Enable or disable the right drawer.
properties.rawdescription: Enable or disable the right drawer.

properties.name: rootNodeModulesPath
properties.description: Path to the root node_modules dir (useful when working in monorepo setup, e.g. yarn workspaces).
properties.rawdescription: Path to the root node_modules dir (useful when working in monorepo setup, e.g. yarn workspaces).

properties.name: rootTagName
properties.description: The name of the root element. By default c8y-bootstrap.
properties.rawdescription: The name of the root element. By default c8y-bootstrap.

properties.name: sensorPhone
properties.description: Enables cloud sensor wizard
properties.rawdescription: Enables cloud sensor wizard

properties.name: source
properties.description: The package source a application origins from as IApplication or simply the id of the source
properties.rawdescription: The package source a application origins from as IApplication or simply the id of the source

properties.name: storageLimitationFeatureEnabled
properties.description: Enable or disable storage limitation feature.
properties.rawdescription: Enable or disable storage limitation feature.

properties.name: supportUrl
properties.description: URL to support page (set to false to hide the link).
properties.rawdescription: URL to support page (set to `false` to hide the link).

properties.name: supportUserString
properties.description: Replacement string for user field in audit logs for actions performed by a support user (available placeholders: {{support_user}}, {{supported_user}}).
properties.rawdescription:
Replacement string for `user` field in audit logs for actions performed by a support user
(available placeholders: `{{support_user}}`, `{{supported_user}}`).

properties.name: tabsHorizontal
properties.description: Show tabs horizontally or vertically.
properties.rawdescription: Show tabs horizontally or vertically.

properties.name: tsConfigPath
properties.description: Path to tsccnfig.json file if TypeScript is used (default: ./tsconfig.json).
properties.rawdescription: Path to tsccnfig.json file if TypeScript is used (default: ./tsconfig.json).

properties.name: upgrade
properties.description: Set to true if the application is hybrid and uses Angular and AngularJS simultaneously.
properties.rawdescription: Set to `true` if the application is hybrid and uses Angular and AngularJS simultaneously.

properties.name: versioningMatrix
properties.description:
A matrix of versions indicating which versions of the application (key) are dependent on which version of a cumulocity component (API version and Web SDK version of the shell application currently supported, indicated by the value). The versions of the dependent components can be indicated by a semver range.

Example :
```json
{
 "1.0.0": {
   "sdk": ">=1016.0.0 <1017.0.0",
   "api": ">=1016.0.0 <1017.0.0"
 },
 "2.0.0": {
   "sdk": "~1017.0.0",
   "api": "~1017.0.0"
 },
 "3.0.0": {
   "sdk": ">=1018.0.0",
   "api": ">=1018.0.0"
 },
}
Example :
